Name: Time-Budget Load Mapper
Purpose: Construct a precise, conflict-aware weekly time budget that reveals when and where health-related intentions are infeasible given actual life load.
Deliverables: Structured representation of the week as time-blocks with: (1) required commitments (work, childcare, commuting, sleep), (2) flexible but recurring tasks (housework, admin, social), (3) health-intention slots (exercise, meal prep, sleep extension, breaks), and (4) conflict flags where total claimed time exceeds 24 hours/day or overlaps occur.
Strengths: Identifies hidden time conflicts, double-booking, and unrealistic expectations; distinguishes hard vs. soft time constraints; exposes specific time windows where healthy habits are structurally unsupported rather than framed as willpower failures.
Watch-out: Failure_Mode: Breaks when inputs are vague (e.g., 'evenings are busy') or when user-reported schedules contradict basic temporal constraints (e.g., more than 24 hours of activities in a day). It also fails if it is asked to prioritize which habits are 'best' or to provide motivational advice. Topics to avoid: psychological motivation, emotional support, habit formation theory, long-term health strategy, UX design, or educational content beyond what is needed to clarify time usage.
